event.title: 1788, the first expedition into the territory, under the command Francisco Esquivel y Aldao, reached

data.event: In 1788, the first expedition into the territory, under the command Francisco Esquivel y Aldao, reached Las Lajas.
In 1882, commander Ortega established a fort for the Argentinian Army.
The town was established on 8 February 1897, by General Enrique Godoy, the Argentinian Army's 4th Division commander.

event.title: was ultimately moved to Neuquén city in 1902

data.event: The capital was ultimately moved to Neuquén city in 1902.

event.title: received its current status of second-category municipality in 1967

data.event: The town received its current status of second-category municipality in 1967.
